title: Water flow into a tank part - d

content.question: During the time interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>2.7</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>4.5</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@41DD@</annotation> </semantics> </math> hours, the rate at which water flows into tank B is modeled by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>w</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mn>21</mn> <mo>−</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>30</mn> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>−</mo> <mn>8</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4839@</annotation> </semantics> </math> liters per hour. Is the difference w(t) − a(t) increasing or decreasing at time t = 3.5 ? Show the work that leads to your answer.

Is the difference w(t) − a(t) increasing or decreasing at time t = 3.5 ? Show the work that leads to your answer.

topic.text: 5.3: Determining Intervals on Which a Function Is Increasing or Decreasing

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Describe the relationships among different representations of functions and their derivatives.
